Mike Deeks on 2014-03-15 23:10:36 (+0000):

Usually milliseconds are dot "." seperated. So it would be 2014-03-15T13:10:01.123-0700



Mike Deeks on 2014-03-15 23:19:39 (+0000):

Sample from the BE logs: 2014-03-14T17:00:03.827-0700

Title: Ops / cron / misc log formats
Description:
We should stick to the ISO standard format like use for all of our other logs. We should also force PDT/PST timezone so it's easy to compare device, FE, BE, etc logs. This is important for Helpshift and Sentry so we can get a good holistic view of all logs.

[df setDateFormat:@“yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ssZ”];

Which gives a timestamp that looks like this:
2014-03-15T13:10:01-0700

Title: [iOS] Add support for recurring events creation & edit
Description:
Today we only allow single instance calendar editing. Users would like to be able to edit all meetings including those with recurrence.



Original Ticket Number: AC-2299

Original Ticket Type: New Feature

Reporter: Kevin Henrikson

Original Components:
iOS - Calendar
Comments:
Jira Comment History:

Kevin Henrikson on 2014-07-09 23:57:13 (+0000):

Continues to be a big user feedback point to email replies



James Colgan on 2015-07-10 17:12:11 (+0000):

This is the #3 requested feature within UserVoice and we constantly get penalized for the lack of this ability. In consideration of implementation, and to understand any potential limitations, confer with the Backend team, Former user and/or David Wang.



Christophe Lamperti on 2015-07-13 16:21:21 (+0000):

And as stated in the Android issue, we also need support for deleting / declining only one occurrence, all the future occurrences or all the occurrences of a recurring event.



Christophe Lamperti on 2015-07-14 01:14:13 (+0000):

This has been identified as a main point to bridge the gap. Just assigned to Ogden Kent for dispatch in the iOS team as soon as possible.
You can use the Sunrise UX as a base for this (attached above).



Christophe Lamperti on 2015-07-14 01:15:53 (+0000):

Also, Joey Dong is the one who implemented the recurring event edition logic at Sunrise, he can guide you through all the cases.



Former user on 2015-07-14 05:12:55 (+0000):

Don't forget about sending notification emails to attendees. Apple and Google calendars handle notifications server side, but we have to do it ourselves for Yahoo, Exchange, O365 and Outlook.com. For O365 and Outlook.com we may be able to take advantage of server side notification if we move to EAS16.



Joey Dong on 2015-07-14 21:31:59 (+0000):

We can roll out the feature in smaller steps since full support is a significant amount of backend work. Today the user is not allowed to create or edit recurring events in any way so it gives us a good baseline to build on. In addition, the clients don't support any offline capabilities so it can even wait for a server roundtrip. The first step would be to support just the creation of recurring events with the frequency modifier only.

Above all else, someone needs to decide where this feature falls on our priorities.



James Colgan on 2015-07-16 16:46:57 (+0000):

Christophe Lamperti, please break this ticket down to the smaller steps Joey Dong refers to so we can start moving into implementation. Note the limitations that Kevin Henrikson walked you through yesterday so we're all very clear.



James Colgan on 2015-07-16 17:16:28 (+0000):

Christophe Lamperti, best way to proceed is to list up the different scenarios (Edit, Create, Delete All, Delete Single) and confer with Former user as to what the limitations are on what the backend can support. All of these tickets need to be moved into a separate epic "Recurrence" as it is so large with implications across the entire system. And it will take multiple sprints to complete. Consider this a functional description ticket. The tickets that come off from this are where the designs to be implemented will reside. Once these other tickets have been created, this ticket can be closed. LMK if this makes sense.



Christophe Lamperti on 2015-07-16 20:15:29 (+0000):

I just created an EPIC containing all these issues: https://acompli.atlassian.net/browse/AC-7861 and added Former user to the discussion there. Closing.

Title: Android: Design Document
Description:
3.2.5.2. Enhancement 1 Design Document

Developer shall deliver an Enhancement 1 Design Document with a detailed description of the functional requirements, architecture and design for the Enhancement 1 that incorporates feedback from the Enhancement 1 Technical Exchange Meeting. At a minimum, the following topics will be addressed:
3.2.5.2.1. Detailed description of new functionality, written in a manner that can be easily translated into test requirements.
3.2.5.2.2. Architecture – APIs, modules, control flow, data flow, schema, file and data formats, communication protocols and connections, required hardware and software operating environment, data storage techniques.
3.2.5.2.3. Operation – user types, user interfaces, use cases, installation including skill level/permissions, resources required, uninstall.
3.2.5.2.4. Other Considerations – standards conformance, interoperability, expandability, security, open issues.



Original Ticket Number: AC-2468

Original Ticket Type: Sub-task

Reporter: Andreas Bezamat-Homer

Original Components:
Android

Title: Android: Technical Exchange Meeting
Description:
3.2.5.1. Enhancement 1 Technical Exchange Meeting

Developer shall conduct an Enhancement 1 Technical Exchange Meeting to discuss development objectives for Enhancement 1. At a minimum, the following topics will be discussed:

3.2.5.1.1. The current state of Developer’s base technology/product, including engineering specifications and operational performance.
3.2.5.1.2. Any ambiguity in the technical description of the effort.
3.2.5.1.3. Customer use cases and requirements.
3.2.5.1.4. Usability and user interface enhancements.
3.2.5.1.5. Operating system and system requirements.
3.2.5.1.6. Process for ingesting and exporting data.
3.2.5.1.7. APIs.
3.2.5.1.8. Security and communications protocols.
3.2.5.1.9. License management and administration.
3.2.5.1.10. The operating mode details identified above in Section 3.2.5.
3.2.5.1.11. Device type and operating system version for the two Android-based smart devices to be delivered as described in Section 3.2.5.5.1 (to be agreed upon by the Parties).
3.2.5.1.12. Server-side deployment requirements such as operating system, physical appliance versus server software (i.e. virtual machine), CPU, memory, etc.
3.2.5.1.13. Deployment requirements, installation and configuration for user and email message volume scale.
3.2.5.1.14. The implementation details identified above in Section 3.2.5.

Format: "=?utf-8?B?" + base64(filename) + "?="

Python code:
headers'Content-Disposition' = 'attachment; filename="=?utf-8?B?%s?="' % b64encode(req.Filename)

Jong Lee on 2014-05-08 02:22:10 (+0000):

There is a blocking issue on Apache httpclient component that BE server is depending on.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1489

Apparently httpclient can't authenticate to contacts.icloud.com which is the CardDAV server for iCloud. Working around this issue may not be trivial.



JJ Zhuang on 2014-05-08 06:51:33 (+0000):

Jong Lee this is interesting. What if instead of waiting for the challenge on 401 you preemptively use basic auth?

I just tried it on contacts.icloud.com. If I don't provide any user/pass, then I get the challenge WWW-Authenticate: X-MobileMe-AuthToken realm="Newcastle", Basic realm="Newcastle"

However if I preemptively use basic auth I get a 200. I don't know much about CardDAV but the response seems to suggest it can work with basic auth?



Jong Lee on 2014-05-08 16:20:44 (+0000):

Yeah, setting up AuthCache for preemptive auth seems to work around this issue.

Title: Calendar: New event not displayed on invitee's calendar till invitee creates a new event in his calendar.
Description:
Abi Ajay from Testlio:

*Environment:*
App Version: 0.29.0i (100393)

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Configure three accounts A1, A2 and A3.
2. I created an event from A1 and sent invites to A2 and A3.
3. On Calendar, even though all three accounts are set to On, I see the invite against A1 only.
4. On long tapping the event, I see the text 'you can't respond to this event'.
5. Now, create an event from A2 and observe the calendar.

*As soon as A2 created an event, the event created by A1 is displayed in A2's calendar.*

*Expected result:*
Two questions:

  • Shouldn't the invite be displayed on A2 and A3's calendars as well? Only on addition of event to calendar, it got refreshed.
  • Why is the organizer not getting any option to respond?

*Actual result:*
The event is not displayed on invitee's calendar till the invitee creates a new event on his calendar.

Logs: https://tools.acompli.net/acompli-ios-logs/ob06ji1fQT



Original Ticket Number: AC-2995

Original Ticket Type: Bug

Reporter: Testlio

Original Components:
Backend
Comments:
Jira Comment History:

Jong Lee on 2014-05-14 03:36:48 (+0000):

This looks like a server issue.



Jong Lee on 2014-05-16 18:11:12 (+0000):

Former user is this because caldav.sync.after.rsvp.receive is set to false?



Former user on 2014-05-16 18:23:23 (+0000):

I don't fully understand the problem. For the two questions/problems, who are the users having the issue?

For the first problem, I'm guessing the bug reporter is saying the new meeting didn't appear in the attendee's calendar view until the attendee created a new meeting on his calendar. This would suggest a sync problem during delivery of initial meeting invite. The reason could vary, from invite not being recognized as an invite because it didn't have the right data, to the remote server having transient problem when we tried to sync.

For the second problem, why would you expect the organizer to be able to respond? Or are you suggesting the "you can't respond to this event" error message is user-unfriendly and shouldn't be shown when organizer long taps an event on calendar? cc Ogden Kent



Testlio on 2014-06-25 14:00:07 (+0000):

Kristi Kaljurand from Testlio:

if tested accounts were gmail, then sync takes time and sometimes when adding new event, trigger sync and that's why event came visible.

Closing this issue as cannot reproduce

Title: Upgrade to m1.xlarge
Description:
Upgrading to m1.xlarge will give us more memory, more disk space, and
faster network performance. Per TB of data, this upgrade will also save us money vs the m1.large instance.

The largest change for upgrading to the m1.xlarge mostly requires us to change the cassandra.yaml file to use multiple data_file_directories, each on their own disk.

So, 1 disk should be allocated to the commitlog and 3 other disks should be allocated to data.



Original Ticket Number: AC-3465

Keith Lazuka on 2014-12-03 18:23:25 (+0000):

This is still a very real issue. There is no affordance at all for the month view gesture or tap. And neither do we teach the user about it onboarding.



James Colgan on 2015-04-01 19:15:27 (+0000):

From a user (Mrohyeahson):

"PLEASE incorporate a month view in the calendar tab. The calendar is way too basic for business/serious users on the go. Having a robust calendar is such a critical piece in choosing an email client. A month view is such a basic function that even the Apple calendar app offers. If the Accompli team boosts this weak calendar function, I think way more people will take this app seriously and convert from Google or Apple apps. For now, I can't say I recommend this above other email clients out there."



Beth Miles on 2015-06-12 21:30:50 (+0000):

Attached .gif shows interstitial message that teaches the user about the interaction. This message would show up the first time a user hits the screen. It would stay up for a few seconds then fade out. When a user expands to see the entire month, we present a message for collapsing the UI.

Some interaction alternatives:

1. Make the user actually perform the interaction of expanding and collapsing the calendar
2. Give the user the ability to dismiss.



Beth Miles on 2015-06-24 00:04:58 (+0000):

Ogden Kent Eddie KimBryan SawlerJon TravisJames ColganDararith Ourk Take a look at the revised UI. Make sure to get your feedback in before Thursday.



Eddie Kim on 2015-06-24 01:39:44 (+0000):
  • I find the gradient on the spotlight a little distracting. maybe this wouldn't be so harsh if the shape was more of a rectangle or the background wasn't so dark. I was imagining something more along the lines of a popover
  • What's the transition into this mode? cross fade in after tapping on calendar?
  • Would there be a way to consolidate this style of tutorial with the popover that we show on People or Files? I think it could be strange as a new user to be tabbing across from mail/calendar/people/files/settings and seeing different styles of popups on each
  • What happens if the user taps on the Month/Year (or anywhere on screen) when the "Tap here to see full month" screen is up? does it automatically kick off the next transition? I think this could feel strange if I'm told to tap on the month/year and it just ends up moving the spotlight
  • I still think that we should educate on ONLY the tap target. I'd rather just show them the easy gesture and let them discover the swipeability on their own


Eddie Kim on 2015-06-24 01:45:50 (+0000):

Another idea...i think it'd be cool if we could force the user to perform one of these actions to get out of the educational mode or maybe just do it for them after they tap "GOT IT". this way they would see what month view is about and hopefully the tutorial will be fresh on their minds if they want to go back to week view or just play around with it.



Beth Miles on 2015-06-24 17:38:24 (+0000):

Generally, I like that idea. Two questions: 1) The pull down interaction is kinda kludgy. It might take a user more than one time to get it right. Do you think this will be liability? 2) How much more work is this?

Title: MAS 4.2.1: Name property of the 'attachment' button in the 'reply' pop up is not defined
Description: We should announce "attach files, button."
ReproSteps:
1. Navigate to any mail in the 'Message list' and double tap to open
  2. Using swipe gestures ,navigate to the 'reply options' button and activate
  3.  Navigate to the 'attachment' icon in the reply short-pop up 
  4. Listen to voice over announcement
ExpectedOutcome: Name property of the button should be defined as 'attachments ' button . Thus the voice over to announce the same.
ActualOutcome:
On navigating to the 'attachment' icon Voiceover just announcing as 'button' .It is not announcing the name of the button.

Note: When in fresh compose screen, the attachment button is having a name.
User Impact: 
Users with no vision who rely on voice over will not able to know the purpose of the button if name property is not defined and hence not accessible for them.

MAS Link:MAS 4.2.1 - Object Information

Title: Local calendar write > Delete exceptions if a series is deleted
Description:
Should we delete exceptions in an event series if the series is deleted? 

cc @Mark Wyszomierski @Michael Andriichuk
ReproSteps:
1. Turn on "local calendar write" feature flag
  2. Connect a local calendar account
  3. Create a recurring event, doesn't matter if it is daily / weekly etc
  4. Open the second instance of the series and edit it (when prompted, choose "This event only") - just change its title, then save 
  5. Select the first instance of the series, and try to delete it (when prompted, choose "All events in series")
  6. Observe that all instances of the event are deleted, even the one you modified in step 4
Tags: Calendar Triaged; local_cal_write; Testlio Verified; Triaged
Comments: Fix confirmed

Title: Local calendar write > editing all day events end up with the wrong time
Description: When you edit an all day event (recurring or non-recurring), after saved it shows up as a day before it should be
ReproSteps:
1. With the local calendar write feature flag enabled
  2. create a recurring series of all-day events
  3. attempt to create an exception of an event in the series (change the title or some field other than the date/time)
  4. verify that the exception is saved correctly and viewed correctly via the sidekick app and the google calendar app
  5. Do the same with non-allday series
  6. Do the same with non-recurring all day events
  7. Same for non-recurring non-allday events

Also to test all day end:

  1. go to draft event activity by clicking the create new event button
  2. toggle the all day switch to on
  3. verify that the duration is shown as "1 day"
  4. save the event and view the event - verify that the duration is "1 day" and the start/end times are correct
  5. repeat for all other stacks
Comments: Fix confirmed

Client calls the actor fetch contacts to get around the contact polling every 2 hours. This is so that users can get newly added/updated/deleted contacts earlier if they are looking for it. This is why we call fetch when the user visits the search query view since that is the entry point to the address book.

Client calls the actor fetch contacts to get around the contact polling every 2 hours. This is so that users can get newly added/updated/deleted contacts earlier if they are looking for it. This is why we call fetch when the user visits the search query view since that is the entry point to the address book.

Client calls the actor fetch contacts to get around the contact polling every 2 hours. This is so that users can get newly added/updated/deleted contacts earlier if they are looking for it. This is why we call fetch when the user visits the search query view since that is the entry point to the address book.

Client calls the actor fetch contacts to get around the contact polling every 2 hours. This is so that users can get newly added/updated/deleted contacts earlier if they are looking for it. This is why we call fetch when the user visits the search query view since that is the entry point to the address book.

Subject: Re: CSS Crit GetContact - ADO:3722827

 

Client calls the actor fetch contacts to get around the contact polling every 2 hours. This is so that users can get newly added/updated/deleted contacts earlier if they are looking for it. This is why we call fetch when the user visits the search query view since that is the entry point to the address book.

Sent from Mail for Windows 10

[HxS - 17134 - 16.0.12218.31452]

Client calls the actor fetch contacts to get around the contact polling every 2 hours. This is so that users can get newly added/updated/deleted contacts earlier if they are looking for it. This is why we call fetch when the user visits the search query view since that is the entry point to the address book.

Title: Support different Certs for Sign and encryption in SMIME
Description:
Build support for different certificates for sign and encryption.

requirements:
https://ghe-us.microsoft.com/outlook-mobile/android/issues/680#issuecomment-321971 

related ticket #3678991
ReproSteps:
Draft scenarios:

  1. create three drafts one signed , one encrypted one signed & encrypted.(you should be able to see sign & encrypt from option menu)
  2. Go to settings > user credential> pick the certs for account we added recently > remove all of them.
  3. come back to app and check the draft we created earlier >A pop up with text staring  "draft could not be decrypted" or "your certificate either is invalid or unavailable" should come. 
  4. if 2nd pop up > clicking on remove should remove the sign/encryption/sign and encryption.
  5. Other wise  clicking ok > it should come out of draft.
Reply scenario:

Follow the steps in prerequisite to again install certificates we removed.

  1. Send 3 mails to your self with these options .(signed/encrypted/signed&encrypted)
  2. check the mail should be able to open with correct tag(signed/encrypted/signed&encrypted)
  3. Go to settings > user credential> pick the certs for account we added recently > remove all of them.
  4. restart app
  5. Go to the mails received from your self > try replying them > they should not be signed or encrypted.>reply on them > should say draft can not be decrypted with a popup

Title: AC REST Office365/OutlookCom accounts created 1d
Description:
+ OLM bug bot to track this


Sent from Outlook

From: Phoebe Shao
Sent: Monday, October 21, 2019 4:05:03 PM
To: Alex Hu; Henry Zhang (RUI); Sathish Sekar; Arnaud Vallat
Cc: Jonathan Brenner; Leo Osahor
Subject: AC REST Office365/OutlookCom accounts created 1d
 

 

As shared in our meeting CC sync up meeting today, one of the reasons for Office365/OutlookCom account creation in AC stack is because of this flow:

 

  • User+client attempt to login as heavy Exchange account, with a server Uri containing “.office365.com” (exo business) or "m.hotmail.com"/“eas.outlook.com" (exo consumer)
  • OM BE detects that this url pattern is no longer supported for heavy Exchange, and throws a “NEED_OTHER_AUTH” error back to the client, with the expected server type set to Office365RestDirect/OutlookMSARest.  This has been the case when we started migrating heavy O365/OutlookCom to REST 3 years back.
  • Client follows the instruction and went ahead to login the account as AC REST Office365/OutlookCom.

 

The sample I found is for iOS, but I think Android might have the same issue. 

 

This can be fixed in the client by: interpret Office365RestDirect/OutlookMSARest auth types in the NEED_OTHER_AUTH  error as Hx instead of AC REST – even though they have the word “Rest” in them.    

Or, if we want to be extremely clean in wording, we can have middle tier return expected auth types like Office365Hx/OutlookHx instead, but I think this is not necessary – let me know.

 

I can repro this with a test account (user2@pshaotest.onmicrosoft.com) in dev on iOS (sorry Sathish I don’t have an Android device 😊): https://dev-powerlift-gym.acompli.net/incidents?installId=jGVtqHx1Zw&incident=6C3F3699-EE5B-4894-852F-54436FBD89E2

Title: Ad telemetry changes (Xandr SDK)
Description:
Following are the telemetry events we currently send, 
  • Ad load error (no fill, missing Ad properties, Ad loaded too frequently)
  • Ad fetch
  • Ad impression
  • Ad click
  • Time user spend away from OM after clicking the Ad
  • Ad criteria satisfaction details (subscription, age,.. and decision to show ad)
Some of the events above are specific to FAN (load, fetch, click). 

So after Xandr integration, should we have a generic Ad events (click, fetch, time away..) irrespective of Ad source or should we separately track for each Ad source?

or any other telemetry of interest? cc @Josh Meisels
Comments:
I think we should still have the fetch, impression, click, and error events regardless of whether the ad comes from Facebook or Xandr. We should add a column for "provider" and use "xandr" or "facebook" in that field to differentiate which one provided the ad. Does that work? Or is it more complicated because of the Xandr+FAN integration where Xandr calls into the FAN SDK for us?

For the criteria details, this is where I want to make sure we match what we did recently on iOS. We have clear documentation on how it works now in the comments of #3546041

Title: Ad View Layout refactoring (Ahead of Xandr SDK integration)
Description:
The FAN SDK requires the Ad view to be wrapped around its own custom View wrapper (`com.facebook.ads.NativeAdLayout`) and also provides its own custom Ad icon view (`com.facebook.ads.MediaView`) but same is not the case with Xandr SDK.

Therefore, there is a need to decouple the rendering flow.

FAN documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/audience-network/android-native-banner
Xandr documentation: https://wiki.xandr.com/display/sdk/Show+Banner+Native+on+Android
Comments: cc @Josh Meisels

Title: Accessibility TestPass: Report Message on Android
Description:
Feature description: 
The Report Message feature allows users to report phishing and spam messages. Functionality varies based on whether you currently have the Report Message add-in installed.

When filing bugs...
Make bugs children of this Feature item: #3365007 
Use Area path: Outlook Mobile\Android
Assignee: Rechee Jozil (rejozil)

Setup Requirements: 
Dev build, feature flag is already enabled.
Can use Outlook.com or O365 account, but in either case you'll need to install the Report Message add-in from here onto the mailbox you're using: https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA104381180?tab=Overview

Test Cases: 
Test the following flows with TalkBack, as well as Large Text.

After installing the add-in to your mailbox and adding that account to Outlook Mobile, reboot the app twice to make sure the feature flags have synced.

Open a spam or phishing email. In the top right, tap the ellipses. Tap on "Report Message." Choose Phishing or Spam from the bottom sheet. You should get a dialogue asking if you want to report the message to Microsoft. Choose to report. Ensure the checkbox on this page works properly.

Go to Nav pane > Settings > Tap on the account > Report messages option. Can choose whether to ask, always report, never report. Make sure this works with TalkBack.

Title: [iOS] Bring in top results for multi-account
Description:
Bring in top results for multi-account scenario:

The API SearchMail has an argument called maxRequestTopResults. When it is 0, you are not requesting top results, but when it is non-zero you are requesting that many results. This applies to both the multi-account and single account scenarios. 


To pull in top results from all accounts, pass in the account IDs as the vector args. 


There is a hard limit of 5 for both single and multi-account.

Title: [Android] Bring in top results for multi-account
Description:
Bring in top results for multi-account scenario:

The API SearchMail has an argument called maxRequestTopResults. When it is 0, you are not requesting top results, but when it is non-zero you are requesting that many results. This applies to both the multi-account and single account scenarios. 


To pull in top results from all accounts, pass in the account IDs as the vector args. 


There is a hard limit of 5 for both single and multi-account.

Title: MAS 2.5.3: The label of the checkbox ( Remember my decision ) is not mapped.
ReproSteps:
1. Open a mail.
  2. Go to more options -> report message and activate it.
  3. As the pop up opens, select any of the options (Spam , Phishing).
  4. And as the pop up opens regarding the "Report message", navigate to the checkbox and listen to the talkback's announcement.
ExpectedOutcome:
The talkback focus should go to the checkbox only once and not to the text separetly and
When the focus is on the checkbox, the talkback should announce "Remember my decision", checkbox Checked/not checked.
ActualOutcome:
1. The name of the checkbox is not announced by the talkback.
  2. The talkback is going to the checkbox and the text separately.
User Impact:
The user with no vision who rely on the screen reader will not be able to the understand the purpose of the checkbox.

MAS Link:- MAS 2.5.3 - Label in Name
Tags: A11yFeature; A11yLowImpact; A11yMAS; Accessibility; MAS2.5.3; Sev4; Wipro
Comments: Completing Pull Request 355489 and the associated work items.
The checkbox and text should be read out by TalkBack as one element where the label of the checkbox is "remember my decision." That makes it clearer to the user what the checkbox is for.

Title: MAS 4.2.12: After marking a mail as Spam/Phishing, the talkback is giving a false information " New Message arrived ".
ReproSteps:
1. Open a mail.
  2. Go to more options -> report message and activate it.
  3. As the pop up opens, select any of the options (Spam , Phishing).
  4. Mark a mail as Spam/Phishing and listen to the talkback's announcement.
ExpectedOutcome: Talkback should not announce "New message arrived".
ActualOutcome:
The talkback is announcing "New message arrived".

User Impact:
The user with no vision who rely on the screen reader will face difficulties as they might understand that new message has been arrived in the inbox section.

MAS Link:  MAS 4.2.12 - Change Notification

Actually I think it’s ok to not check certValidationStatus in fetchRecipientsEncryptionCertificates. Because after fetchRecipientsEncryptionCertificates is completed, the call for validateRecipientsEncryptionStatus is called on line 747 of DraftPersistenceAction, which does check certValidationStatus.

Yeah but that check is in validateRecipientsEncryptionCertificates.  I'm talking about fetchRecipientsEncryptionCertificates.  The function above it.  Lines 1743-1749.  That one is missing the check for the certValidationStatus and assume anything that has a certificate is valid.

Subject: Re: S/MIME: Draft error

 

Thanks for looking at that Bryan. It looks like the code does have the logic you would expect to have. On lines 1818-1821 of OLMHxMessage.swift, there is a check for the certValidationStatus. If the certValidationStatus is not valid,  for example notAttempted, it is included in the list of invalid recipients. So the fetchRecipientsEncryptionCertificates returns a list of recipients who have either no certificate or invalid certValidationStatus.

Cc: Zoe Cheng <Ye.Cheng@microsoft.com>; Dewayne Perry <Dewayne.Perry@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: S/MIME: Draft error

 

I only have one guess and I might be reading this code wrong because I don't know swift that well.  But if they are trying to send to an external recipient then fetchEncryptionCertificates will end up with that recipient in this state:

encryptionCertFetchStatus = fetchcompleted

encryptionCertificate not empty

certValidationStatus is notattempted

 

But if I'm reading the code in fetchRecipientsEncryptionCertificates in OLMHxMessage.swift correctly when it's building the unfetchedRecipients it will not include this recipient (since it has a certificate that was fetched).  Then that recipient's certificate is not validated in a call to validateRecipientsEncryptionCertificates so it stays notattempted as it's certValidationStatus so it's not valid.

 

The fetchRecipientsEncryptionCertificates seems to be returning a list of recipients without certificates as it's invalid list.  But what is needs to the ones without certificates and the one with certificates but certValidationStatus  is not valid.

Comments:
@Corbin Reynolds 
From Zoe on a related issue with forwarding encrypted messages "

Figured out the cause. We are not waiting for the add recipient action completed before sending in compose v2. So if you send right away after adding the recipient, it fails since no recipient gets added. But if you want some time after adding the recipient and send, it works. "


I am thinking that must be related to this issue as well with replying. We have not been able to repro the issue with replying to an encrypted messages but it seems that the forwarding issue is related to this so I will investigate a fix to solve that problem.

@Corbin Reynolds I believe the issue is because we're potentially not validating the certificates in the case of replying to messages as we are when creating messages using validateUserSmimeCertificates. I'm still investigating and will make more progress now that the other message loading issue is gone.
@Dewayne Perry Can you add an update here of what the current state of the investigation is?

Title: MAS 2.4.3: Voice over focus reset observed on activating the pop up buttons in the New Message screen
ReproSteps:
1. Navigate to the 'Compose' button and double tap to activate it
  2. Navigate to the ' sending mail address/ add meeting/ add attachment' buttons and activate
  3. Observe the voice over focus and announcement
ExpectedOutcome: On activating the ' sending mail address/ add meeting/ add attachment' pop up button ,Voice over focus land on the first interactive element in the pop up and all the items in the popup should be accessible with swipe gestures.
ActualOutcome:
Activating 'sending mail address/ add meeting/ add attachment' buttons ,voice over focus is reset to where the  insertion point is focused currently(Ex: To /CC/Bcc/Subject fields) and Looping in those edit fields. 

Note: Using single finger explore able to navigate on the pop up
User Impact:
Users with no vision who rely on screen readers will not able to access the 'sending mail address/ add meeting/ add attachment'  pop up options.

MAS Link: MAS 2.4.3 - Focus Order
Tags: A11yMAS; A11yMediumImpact; A11yRT; Accessibility; MAS2.4.3; Sev3; Wipro
Comments: This makes it difficult for users who rely on VoiceOver to access the options they want.

Title: MAS 4.2.1: Incorrect announcement made by Talkback at ' Search home mail box' button in the Search edit field
ReproSteps:
1. Navigate to the 'Search 'tab item and activate it
  2. Navigate to the search edit field and activate it
  3. Using tab key navigate on to the 'Search home mail box' button 
  4. Listen to the Talkback announcement
ExpectedOutcome: Talkback should announce 'Search home mail ' box when there are no accounts selected .
ActualOutcome:
On navigating to the 'Search home mail box' button ,Talkback announcing as currently selected null, drop down list

Note: If any account is selected then announcement of the Talkback is correct

User Impact: Users with no vision who rely on screen readers will get confused with the Talkback announcement

MAS Link:MAS 4.2.1 - Object Information
Tags: A11yLowImpact; A11yMAS; A11yRT; Accessibility; MAS4.2.1; Sev4; Triaged; Wipro
Comments:
This issue is fixed .Hence closing this bug

Title: [Commute] Store Commute settings preferences
Change Toolbar color for Search
Description:
Change status bar colour for search based on if search is active or not

Handle Dark mode

Title: Investigate on demand localized files
Description: Localized files are a significant chunk of our app size. Each language takes up 200-300kb and we support ~80 languages. Moving most of the strings to an on demand model could save a significant chunk of app size.

Title: Investigate on demand resources
Description: There may be significant areas where we can further utilize on demand resources to shrink the app size.

Title: Find and remove stale features (and their assets)
Description: Outlook has been around for a while now. We are almost certainly going to have features which are no longer accessible and can be removed. These should be cleared out, along with any assets, to reduce the app size.

Title: Investigate Link Time Optimization
Description: How much does this reduce our app size by? How much does it slow the build down by? Can we safely just apply to prod builds? etc.

Title: Investigate App Thinning
Description: We should look into how we can leverage app thinning to further reduce the size of our app.

Title: [iOS][Hx] implement reauth for Hx Google Cloud Cache/Gmail CC
Description: ETA EOW 11/1 (Push to Dev)
ReproSteps:
Testing:

  1. Turn on HxGoogleCloudCache feature flag
  2. Add Hx gmail account
  3. Go to settings -> debug action -> account actions -> reauth account
  4. Tap on re-auth account
  5. Go back to message list and tap on status bar

Title: [iOS][Hx] migrate AC Gmail CC to Hx Gmail CC
Description: Need code to migrate from AC Gmail CC to Hx Gmail CC
ReproSteps:
Testing migrating to Hx:

  1. Make sure HxGoogleCloudCache feature flag is on
  2. Add AC gmail CC account
  3. Go to settings -> account settings
  4. Toggle "Migrate to Hx"
  5. Should see account migrated to Hx

Testing migrating to AC:

  1. Make sure HxGoogleCloudCache feature flag is on
  2. Add Hx gmail CC account
  3. Go to settings -> account settings
  4. Toggle "Migrate to Hx"
  5. Should see account migrated to AC
  6. Will need to re-auth since we don't send the shadow tokens to AC (this will be changed in another PR if this is important enough).
Comments: Fix confirmed

OK in 4.13.0 using iPhone 6s, iOS 13.1.3 for HX Gmail CloudCache and AC Gmail CloudCache accounts(ten.mion@gmail.com/Test123456)

Comments:
@Francisco Villegas Sanchez  This looks like the `SaveDraft` Actor API seems to be failing here. May be related to the draft sync issues we have seen before.  Can you please take a look at this as well?

On Send button being disabled, it looks like from the OM code that if there is a `fatalSaveError` (Which is related to not able to save drafts) while composing then the send button is being disabled and the alert is shown and that's why you were seeing that message constantly because it was not able to save the draft and error was being returned.


Maybe after this draft problem is fixed from the Hx side, can you try to reproduce this again? My guess is all this might be related to draft syncing errors.

Title: [iOS][Gallatin] O365 Account Testing
Description:
For O365 accounts in Gallatin environment:

1) We need to test primary app functions to ensure things are working as expected: login, send mail, receive mail, create calendar events, receive cal invites, etc.
2) We need to run probes to confirm that the no restricted data is leaving the compliance boundary. Please see two attachments for more information on what data we need to ensure does not leave Gallatin.

Title: [iOS] Investigate Font Size Differences Between Mail.app and OM
Description:
No problem!

@OLM Bug Bot 

Get Outlook for iOS
From: Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 29, 2019 5:58:29 AM
To: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>; Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; Daohan Chong <Daohan.Chong@microsoft.com>
Cc: Jiayue Yi <jiyi@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
@Daohan Chong Can you take a look at this tomorrow? I wonder if we are persisting some styling in ComposeRooster that we shouldn't be.

Corbin

Sent from Outlook

From: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>
Sent: Monday, October 28, 2019 1:15 PM
To: Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
Thanks. As I age - my ability to see the tiniest text is declining which makes me both sad and motivated to improve this 
From: Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>
Sent: Monday, October 28, 2019 1:03 PM
To: Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>
Cc: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>
Subject: Fwd: Font sizes
 
Corbin, I see the same issue that Omar mentioned. Not sure who this is. The first mail I sent was from Web. See the difference? Thinking we might want to ping someone on OWA? 


Get Outlook for iOS
From: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>
Sent: Monday, October 28, 2019 8:21:05 AM
To: Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>
Subject: Font sizes
 
Hey Michael for the messages that I’m sending from OWA I’m just using the default font but as you can see in outlook mobile it appears pretty small. That is especially true when compared to the native rendering of the Outlook mobile app

Get Outlook for iOS
Comments:
Thx Corbin!

-Omar
I'm going to repurpose this ticket to investigate the differences in what Mail.app is doing. I think it's entirely possible the Mail.app has different default styling that might be changing the scale for small fonts.

It sounds like there is also a potential opportunity to understand what they are doing and improve our own sizing, particularly around the small cases.

Corbin

Sent from Outlook

From: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 30, 2019 2:11 PM
To: Daohan Chong <Daohan.Chong@microsoft.com>; Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>; Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; OLM Bug Bot <olmbug@microsoft.com>
Cc: Jiayue Yi <jiyi@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
Here is a SxS of Apple mail and Outlook. My eyes believe Apple mail is a smidge bigger but maybe it’s font related ?


From: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 30, 2019 6:57:49 AM
To: Daohan Chong <Daohan.Chong@microsoft.com>; Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>; Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; OLM Bug Bot <olmbug@microsoft.com>
Cc: Jiayue Yi <jiyi@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
I have set the Dynamic text to the default and that has improved things a bit - still not what I'd like but I appreciate the investigation and analysis.

i'll compare to Apple Mail and see if there are any big differences that I notice.

-Omar
From: Daohan Chong <Daohan.Chong@microsoft.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 29, 2019 8:53 PM
To: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>; Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>; Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; OLM Bug Bot <olmbug@microsoft.com>
Cc: Jiayue Yi <jiyi@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
Hello Omar,

Thanks for referring to the workspace survey case. But your email send on OWA and the workspace survey should be to two different cases.

Concerning the workspace survey, I did some investigation and found that:
The survey email is using a fixed width so that it may be scaled down in OM. It is not scaled down so much on MOWA possibly because it apply another width adjustment. I found this in their code in browser:
@media (max-width: 100vw) {
    ._3WlLk_4fUx7lOD6tu-MdWQ table {
        width: 100%!important;
    }
}
This is a good approach and also a nice opportunity for us to improve. We'll analyze the possible side effects for this approach and have a discussion about it later. Since some emails depend on fixed-width table for their layout, changing this behavior may have some unexpected effects.

As you can see in the screenshots below, OM does not scale down the email with flexible width.



I also did some comparison with my screens in office. 
The font size on ~@1x screen is considerably larger than that on iPhone. I believe that's the reason why 10pt font text looks huge on your OWA.






Changing the font size on iPhone could likely be to a good solution in your case: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202828
Change the font size on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch - Apple Support
You can change the size of your font in Mail, Contacts, Calendar, Phone, Notes, and other apps that support Dynamic Type.
support.apple.com

Best wishes,
Daohan

From: Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 30, 2019 1:59 AM
To: Daohan Chong <Daohan.Chong@microsoft.com>; Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>; Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; OLM Bug Bot <olmbug@microsoft.com>
Cc: Jiayue Yi <jiyi@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
Compare these two. Outlook mobile is tiny. Other screen is MOWA. This is on an iPhone 11 Pro Max



From: Daohan Chong <Daohan.Chong@microsoft.com>
Sent: Tuesday, October 29, 2019 8:39:03 AM
To: Corbin Reynolds <Corbin.Reynolds@microsoft.com>; Omar Shahine <Omar.Shahine@microsoft.com>; Michael Palermiti <michaelp@microsoft.com>; OLM Bug Bot <olmbug@microsoft.com>
Cc: Jiayue Yi <jiyi@microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
Hi Omar,

I think the reason is that different device screens have different scales. For example, Apple devices may have @2x and @3x scale factors: https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/ios/icons-and-images/image-size-and-resolution/
I am not sure what kind of screen are you using for OWA. If it is @1x, 10pt font may look good on it but very small on iPhone.

If we use "pt" as the unit for font size, the text will look different with different scale factors. Here is an example:

I don't have a @1x device on hand right now but I can add more comparison tomorrow if needed. Subject: Re: Font sizes
 
Hello Omar,

Thanks for referring to the workspace survey case. But your email send on OWA and the workspace survey should be to two different cases.

Concerning the workspace survey, I did some investigation and found that:
The survey email is using a fixed width so that it may be scaled down in OM. It is not scaled down so much on MOWA possibly because it apply another width adjustment. I found this in their code in browser:
@media (max-width: 100vw) {
    ._3WlLk_4fUx7lOD6tu-MdWQ table {
        width: 100%!important;
    }
}
This is a good approach and also a nice opportunity for us to improve. We'll analyze the possible side effects for this approach and have a discussion about it later. Since some emails depend on fixed-width table for their layout, changing this behavior may have some unexpected effects.

As you can see in the screenshots below, OM does not scale down the email with flexible width.



I also did some comparison with my screens in office. 
The font size on ~@1x screen is considerably larger than that on iPhone. I believe that's the reason why 10pt font text looks huge on your OWA.






Changing the font size on iPhone could likely be to a good solution in your case: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202828
Change the font size on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch - Apple Support
You can change the size of your font in Mail, Contacts, Calendar, Phone, Notes, and other apps that support Dynamic Type.
support.apple.com

Best wishes,
Daohan

Hello Omar,

Thanks for referring to the workspace survey case. But your email send on OWA and the workspace survey should be to two different cases.

Concerning the workspace survey, I did some investigation and found that:
The survey email is using a fixed width so that it may be scaled down in OM. It is not scaled down so much on MOWA possibly because it apply another width adjustment. I found this in their code in browser:
@media (max-width: 100vw) {
    ._3WlLk_4fUx7lOD6tu-MdWQ table {
        width: 100%!important;
    }
}
This is a good approach and also a nice opportunity for us to improve. We'll analyze the possible side effects for this approach and have a discussion about it later. Since some emails depend on fixed-width table for their layout, changing this behavior may have some unexpected effects.

As you can see in the screenshots below, OM does not scale down the email with flexible width.



I also did some comparison with my screens in office. 
The font size on ~@1x screen is considerably larger than that on iPhone. I believe that's the reason why 10pt font text looks huge on your OWA.






Changing the font size on iPhone could likely be to a good solution in your case: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202828
Change the font size on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch - Apple Support
You can change the size of your font in Mail, Contacts, Calendar, Phone, Notes, and other apps that support Dynamic Type.
support.apple.com

Best wishes,
Daohan

Hi Omar,

I think the reason is that different device screens have different scales. For example, Apple devices may have @2x and @3x scale factors: https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/ios/icons-and-images/image-size-and-resolution/
I am not sure what kind of screen are you using for OWA. If it is @1x, 10pt font may look good on it but very small on iPhone.

If we use "pt" as the unit for font size, the text will look different with different scale factors. Here is an example:

I don't have a @1x device on hand right now but I can add more comparison tomorrow if needed. The difference between @2x and @3x screens are not very clear but you can see the text on the left screen (iPad Pro 12.9'') is a bit larger. You can also try these font sizes on: https://d-example-2.azurewebsites.net/index.html and https://d-example-2.azurewebsites.net/index_2.html. These two web pages are built by me for demo.

Could you please try to use larger font size on iOS and keep 10pt font size setting for OWA? I think it may feel better potentially. 

Best wishes,
Daohan

Get Outlook for iOS

Hi Omar,

I think the reason is that different device screens have different scales. For example, Apple devices may have @2x and @3x scale factors: https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/ios/icons-and-images/image-size-and-resolution/
I am not sure what kind of screen are you using for OWA. If it is @1x, 10pt font may look good on it but very small on iPhone.

If we use "pt" as the unit for font size, the text will look different with different scale factors. Here is an example:

I don't have a @1x device on hand right now but I can add more comparison tomorrow if needed. The difference between @2x and @3x screens are not very clear but you can see the text on the left screen (iPad Pro 12.9'') is a bit larger. You can also try these font sizes on: https://d-example-2.azurewebsites.net/index.html and https://d-example-2.azurewebsites.net/index_2.html. These two web pages are built by me for demo.

Could you please try to use larger font size on iOS and keep 10pt font size setting for OWA? I think it may feel better potentially. 

Best wishes,
Daohan

Including the MOWA screenshot again since it looks like it failed.

Title: [Android][Gallatin] O365 Account Testing
Description:
For O365 accounts in Gallatin environment:

1) We need to test primary app functions to ensure things are working as expected: login, send mail, receive mail, create calendar events, receive cal invites, etc.
2) We need to run probes to confirm that the no restricted data is leaving the compliance boundary. Please see two attachments for more information on what data we need to ensure does not leave Gallatin.
Comments: Copied with all attachments and links from Task 3742643

Title: [iOS][Gallatin] Hybrid Account Testing
Description:
NOTE: Let's focus on completing O365 testing before we start this task: TASK 3742643

For hybrid accounts in Gallatin environment:

1) We need to test primary app functions to ensure things are working as expected: login, send mail, receive mail, create calendar events, receive cal invites, etc.

2) We need to run probes to confirm that no restricted data is leaving the compliance boundary. This includes the partitioning of new managed on-prem cloud cache mailboxes for hybrid accounts. To test, we will need to:
  • Get a test account (in a Gallatin test tenant) that has NOT YET had a MOPCC mailbox partitioned
  • Log into OLM using the test account to trigger the partitioning of a MOPCC mailbox
  • Run probes to confirm that the cloud cache mailbox was created in Gallatin and that no data is leaving the compliance boundary.
Please see two attachments for more information on what data we need to ensure does not leave Gallatin.
Comments: Let's focus on completing O365 testing before we start this task: TASK 3742643
Copied with all attachments and links from Task 3742643

Title: [iOS][Gallatin] Hide Helpshift & UserVoice for Commercial Users
Description:
All help and support for commercial Gallatin users is managed by our Chinese partner, 21Vianet.

In Settings menu, hide entire "Help & Feedback" section including:
  • Contact Support
  • Suggest a Feature
  • FAQs
ReproSteps:
Step 1: Sign-in using any account other than Gallatin (China) account.
Step 2: Go to Help and Feedback in Settings and check the Help and feedback section
Step 3: Add a Gallatin account 
Step 4: Go to Help and Feedback in Settings and check that the Help and feedback section
ExpectedOutcome:
1. You should be able to sign-in.
  2. You should be able to see Help and feedback section along with the Troubleshooting and About section
  3. The Gallatin account should be added.
  4. You should NOT be able to Help and feedback section but should see the Troubleshooting and About section.
Comments: Completing Pull Request 363717 and the associated work items.

@Tejas Shah @Ashish Rathore

Hi Tejas, good clarifying question. Yes, we should hide the "Help & Feedback" section and continue to show the "Troubleshooting" and "About" sections. See screenshot below. And yes, this rule should apply to any user who has a Gallatin account connected (regardless of whether they have additional accounts connected or not).

Your question raises an important point though. Support for Gallatin users is managed by our Chinese partner, 21Vianet, but support for consumer users in China is handled by Microsoft. For users with both consumer and commercial accounts connected, how do we enable users to get in-app support for their consumer accounts? I've created a separate task for us to deal with this at a later date. For the initial rollout, we can proceed as we've discussed.

@Elliot Robia , 
Few questions regarding this:

In settings-> Help & feedback --> 
There is a section of Help & feedback which consists of following 
  • Contact Support
  • Suggest a Feature
  • FAQs​

  • Support Language

Should we be hiding the complete above section and have other sections like "TroubleShooting" and "About" visible??

Also even if there exist one Gallatin account in the list of accounts, we will be hiding the above mentioned settings. Right?

cc @Ashish Rathore

Title: [iOS][Gallatin] Conference Room Search & Booking
Description:
According to Victoria Rodriguez, the LAS service (which handles both a) room availability/booking and b) lookup for public places like Starbucks) is scheduled to be deployed to Gallatin in Dec 2019.

After the service is deployed, we need to ensure that room search and booking works correctly in Gallatin using OLM. Public place lookup will be tracked in a separate ticket due to it's reliance on Bing.
Comments: @Victoria Rodriguez Can you please keep us posted on this?

Title: [iOS] search messages older than 30 days for M-OPCC accounts
Description:
From Tarun:

Hi Folks,
 
As per our last discussion, we agreed on using the option to show search results for empty folders for OM users. Did we made any progress on initial client spec/design? Let me know if you need any help from our end.
 
Problem:
For user who has more than 30 days of data in Azure Heavy, they won’t find older emails in their folders in CloudCache (think of ‘my tax returns’ folder which might have only 3-6 emails in last 3 years) .
For most users 30 days should be enough to show (they’ll use search to find older stuff), but there will be cases, especially in non-Inbox folders, where the user might expect more and could see empty folders where older emails are stored. This can also be perceived as "Data loss" by the user who will end up contacting customer support (bad experience and cost of support).
 
Agreed solution:
Have client show message similar to “Looks like you have more messages on server, click here to search them”. Clicking the button, downloads ‘n’ messages in the folder by date.
 
Question:
Do we need a new REST endpoint for this search or existing one should work (note that in this query we are searching by folderID and ‘n’ emails in last days, we should try downloading enough emails to build view for few pages).
Limitations:
Replays won’t be played against these results and messages will get deleted faster.
In current design  this folder is the default search folder. We talked about opportunity to stich a view where the results appear to be in same folder (as we will have FolderIDs available in search results). @Alex Hu did you checked if same is possible.
 
How does email App on iOS do it?
 
iOS provides option to choose “Sync window” to the user in settings. Note that its “No limit” after 1 month.
Comments:
Not a blocker for production. 
Revisit @Leo Osahor
Copied with all attachments and links from Task 3642579

Title: [DarkModeKit] Integrate DarkModeKit through Carthage

Title: [Add-ins][Online Meeting Integration]To get TEE conferenceInfo Extended Property via Hx sync.
Description:
Earlier we were making REST call to sync TEE conferenceInfo Extended Property for particular event. 
Now Hx has provided this property as a part of HxAppointmentBody. So join experience will be much faster as we don't need to make a call for REST API.
ReproSteps:
Step 1: login with given Hx Account , it already has BlueJeans Meeting add-in installed.
Step 2: enable below given feature flag of online meeting integration and restart app.
feature flag:  Addins Online Meeting Integration
step 3: open calendar and create event, UI should be similar to attached screenshot .
step 4: add meeting details, enable BlueJeans Meeting toggle 
Expected behavior:  Bluejeans add-in shall get launched in the background and online meeting link and description should get added in description,  after the add-in execution is successful. The toggle button should also be in on state. has been added to the description, send it.

step 5: After syncing from server, Open the meeting created using bluejeans add-in and check if JOIN button comes up.
Expected Behavior: JOIN button to be shown and on tapping the JOIN, the user should be taken to browser or if bluejeans app is already installed then the App.
ExpectedOutcome: Join button UI should come without any delay when screen loads.

Title: Local calendar write > Support event notifications for multiple event reminders
Description: Now that we allow multiple reminders for local calendar events, we should respect the multiple reminders and show notifications for all reminders. Right now we just pick the first reminder. See `EventNotificationJob.java`
ReproSteps:
1. With the localCalendarNotifications feature flag turned on
  2. Add a local event with multiple reminders (from google calendar)
  3. Add that calendar as a local calendar in outlook
  4. Verify that you get notifications for each reminder
  5. Verify that you still get notifications for HX and AC stacks
Comments: Fix confirmed

Title: APK Size: Simplify database upgrade cases
Description: We currently allow upgrade from as far back as version 23 of the database, which was 2015.  The method itself for upgrade is very long, and we can probably reduce 10-15 KB just in reducing the size of that method.  Plus, make it more readable without affecting functionality

Hi,

So I can’t repro it on this new build or with the new software update I did (split view was being weird in general so I updated).

However the not adjusting I took a video to show - it seems to only be WXP documents, PDFs scale fine


Get Outlook for iOS
From: Luna Zheng <Jingshi.Zheng@microsoft.com>
Sent: Monday, October 28, 2019 10:43:03 PM
To: Larissa Perara <Larissa.Perara@microsoft.com>; OM iOS Shaker <omiosshaker@service.microsoft.com>; OM Design Shaker <omdesignshaker@service.microsoft.com>
Subject: Re: iPad split view
 

Hi Larissa,

 

What do you mean scroll attachments? I can scroll attachments in compose, and also can scroll attachments in file preview if they have more than one page.

For the split view, it seems only attachments are cut, do you mean it? These attachments also can be scrolled in latest DEV in my simulator.

 

From: Larissa Perara <Larissa.Perara@microsoft.com>
Date: Tuesday, October 29, 2019 at 9:26 AM
To: OM iOS Shaker <omiosshaker@service.microsoft.com>, OM Design Shaker <omdesignshaker@service.microsoft.com>
Subject: iPad split view

Are we aware that splits view doesn’t seem to let it scroll attachments. Additionally, if you open something in the previewer and then drag it into split view, it does not adjust properly, I.e it’s cut off. Are we aware of these issues?

Title: [Android] User can't install S/MIME certificate
Description:
From Ross: 


User can’t install the S/MIME cert on Outlook for Android. He gets “This action is not allowed by your organization.” 

I suspect MAM is in play here, though I thought the save as policy was tested by Lance and deemed not a blocker for cert installation.

Title: [iOS] Memoji: Change the default size to 140.33
Description: After talking with @Erin Woo, we decided to follow Apple's usage of Memoji in compose: Specify the image width of 140.33.

Title: [Android] Local Calendar > Get reminder alert string for multi reminders
Description:
When converting EventReminder to String using method ReminderHelper.getReminderAlertStringMulti(), if reminder.getReminderInMinutes() is 0, we'll return "", however in this case we should return "At time of event"

When converting EventReminder of all day events using method ReminderHelper.buildRemindersString():
  1. "On day of event at 9:00 AM" will be converted to an empty string
  2. "1 day before at 9:00 AM" will be converted to "15 hours"
  3. "1 week before" will be converted to "6 days 15 hours"

We should use the same format for local calendar events and email calendar events
Comments: Mentioned in Pull Request 352675

Title: [MSOUTLOOK-740] [N770F][OXM][Service App/MS Outlook] show content menu is not visible
Description:
■ Version info : outlook-4.0.51
■ Test device : SM-N770F_EUR_XX (U0ASJ9 )

■ Precondition
- Testbed sim mounting (4G status)
- usage account : EAS, IMAP, Hotmail,POP3 ,Gmail
- Secure folder mode (add outlook status)

■ Occur path :
1. outlook settings >calendar > notifications > random account sound entry > Check lock screen menu

■ Occurrence Status : show content menu is not visible

* Incident ID : 4377506C


MSOUTLOOK-740 -- Priority B
Comments: Great thanks, that was pretty buried. I sent that description over to them.

Tried on a Samsung phone, the option "Show content" is visible only if user allows lock screen notification. This can be set in "Lock screen > Notifications". Once lock screen notification is turned on, the "Show content" is visible in Outlook notification settings.

@Mitali Jain @Mark Wyszomierski  Can you please check with Samsung if they have turned off this setting? If so, this bug is by design.

Title: Add voice animation
Cortini UI Accessibility
Description:
Hi Denis,

After meeting with OM accessibility PM, here is the summary of the requirements we need to meet for accessibility:

 

  • The E2E Assistant experience will work with talkback screen reader (the mic in the search box, the welcome message on the canvas, and the final voice command query)
  • When users tap on the microphone in the search box, we should provide couple Hints via voice to manage users’ expectation
  • Have talkback confirm when showing the search result
  • Make sure talkback tell users that they can re-prompt the microphone on the canvas after the timeout
  • For more info please refer to Contents for Android Access​ibility

 

You can also check with Steven for details as we just went through the process yesterday.

When the work is done please let me know so I can create an ADO task for the accessibility. Please be noted that we need to pass accessibility test before MSIT ring thanks!

 

If you have other question, please let me know.

 

 

Regards,

Beryl
Comments: Here is the test request link https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_workitems/edit/3771626
@Denis Fisenko 👽  Hi Denis, as discussed, i will go ahead and schedule a test today. The test should start in 1-2 days and the testing team will let us know how many/what bugs they find. Thanks!

We also need to make sure the labels are descriptive and meaningful when talkback is turned on, and the wipe forward/back to navigate + double tap to activate actions all work. If there is a long UI string, it is worth adjusting the font size (Accessibility > Large text) to make sure they are still readable.

Title: [iOS] Add InternetMessageID to Mail_Action
Description:
See parent bug. This is for just Mail_Action so that it is easier to see the flow of changes since they are very different changes and make the review experience better and easier to backport if necessary for some reason. 

"Bryan Butteling from the SIGS team has requested that we add InternetMessageId (IMID) to several events; mail_action and read_conversation.

I believe this value is available in Hx. It probably is not available in AC, but that is probably OK - or can be taken as a separate task if not."
ReproSteps: n/a
Comments: Completing Pull Request 361794 and the associated work items.

Title: Add Cortini hints UI
Description:
These are the final strings we can use for Hints, we will not do Bookmark now as Bookmark won't be shipped to production. We will revisit Bookmark later.

Use case with priorityQtips-Hints
EmailsFind emails from name
 Show me emails from name
 What’s the last email from name?
 Find the last email from name
 Show me the last email from name
PeopleFind name
 Find name’s contact info
 What’s name’s email?
[Variables ][email/phone #/contact]
  
Meeting/EventsWhat's my next meeting?
 Show me my next meeting
 What’s next?
 What do I have next?
[variables][meeting/event/appointment]
  
FileFind files from name
 Show files that name sent me
 What’s the last attachment from name?
 Show me files from name
 Find name’s files from last month
 Show me recent attachments
[variables][files/attachments/docs/presentations]

Title: Use property change listener for speller results
Description: Currently, there is no way to listen to individual property changes on hx objects, thus the speller callback is being hit on every unrelated MailSearchSession change. Once property change listening is implemented, we should listen for changes on speller properties only.

Title: Accessibility TestPass: Online meeting integration via add-ins (Android)
Description:
Feature description: 
Feature allows 3rd party meeting providers to support meeting creation within Outlook for Android. We will test using the BlueJeans add-in. 

When filing bugs...
Make bugs children of this Feature item: #3282316 
Use Area path: Outlook Mobile\Android\Add-Ins
Assignee: kapgupt (Kapil Kumar Gupta)

Setup Requirements: 
Feature is enabled in dev build.
Supports Hx accounts only - Outlook.com or O365

Test Cases:

Step 1: Add the account listed below to Outlook - it already has BlueJeans Meeting add-in installed.


step 2: open calendar and create event. Notice that instead of Teams it shows BlueJeans meeting option.


step 3: add meeting details, enable BlueJeans Meeting Switch, it will start add-in execution, once meeting details has synced to description, send it.


step 4: open created meeting and test join experience and edit mode, on clicking Join button, it should open BlueJeans meeting in browser(if app is not installed/ ask for which app to open for meeting).


Note: During edit of an existing meeting add-in will be disabled.

  • preferred test account for outlook:
    • email: meganb@androidaddins.onmicrosoft.com
    • password: kapgupt@1590
  • test account to login in BlueJeans add-in or app: (you will only need this if the add-in prompts you to log in on first use):
    • email: @Kapil Kumar Gupta
    • password: Kapgupt@1590
ReproSteps: .
Comments: Completed. Resolving.
We have started testing this feature.

Title: [MSOUTLOOK-741] [Andrés Cordero Monterrubio] Outlook and Intune Company Portal do not work if both applications are installed.
Description:
Outlook Version: 4.0.51

Intune Company Portal Version: 5.0.4560.0

The user reports that If Outlook and and Intune Company Portal applications are installed altogether in the same device none of them works.

Uninstalling Intune Company Portal application Outlook application start working again.



Intune Company Portal is an enterprise suite application crated by Microsoft that makes the user able to access corporative e-mail amongst other features for enterprise users.





MSOUTLOOK-741 -- Priority B
Comments: @Mark Wyszomierski it is at 100%
@James Oakley just checking in on the rollout status, can you let me know when rollout hits 100%, thanks
Ok thanks a lot James, I'll ask them to try again after the rollout completes (next week).

@Mark Wyszomierski 
This is a known Company Portal crash on the Samsung Android 10 builds (currently only in beta) affecting users who are MDM-enrolled with the Device Administrator mechanism. While the crash is in MDM components, it also bubbles into MAM-integrated apps. The Intune MDM team has fixed this in Company Portal build 5.0.4588.0, which is currently rolling out. Affected beta users may opt-in to the Company Portal beta to receive the update now. It is expected to be fully rolled out by the end of next week.

Microsoft had early access to Samsung beta builds, but due to a coordination oversight they weren't passed on to my team (Intune MAM). That oversight has been corrected for future validation of Samsung builds.

I haven't asked Samsung for more info yet, but searching through the attached logs there are fatal exceptions we can look at first, snippet below. @James Oakley adding you early if this might be in your domain - cc @Arnaud Vallat as well for visibility

Title: [MSOUTLOOK-742] [셋팅/Settings] Settings > Accounts and backup > Accounts > Error occurs when add Outlook account
Description:
folder move : P191004-04535



[Reproduce path]

1. Settings > Accounts and backup > Accounts screen

2. Add count > Outlook

3. account / password input



[Issue]

1. The connection to your mail server timed out~ Error occurs





MSOUTLOOK-742 -- Priority A
Comments: Thanks that's great - I'll ask them to test this with v4.0.53+
@Mark Wyszomierski @Arnaud Vallat It is available only from 4.0.30 onwards. That is after 10/04 PROD builds

I asked for a PL. I can see in the logs they were running v4.0.16. 

  versionCode=350 minSdk=21 targetSdk=28
  versionName=4.0.16

@Sathish Sekar could you help us out by taking a look at the video - should the Outlook option be hidden in ChooseAccountFragment in this case? I'm not sure if that was working in v4.0.16 yet, or if they've connected the account previously as a different type.

cc @Arnaud Vallat for visibility
